## Problem 1

First, clean the data in pols-month.csv. 

Use separate() to break up the variable mon into integer variables year, month, and day; replace month number with month name; create a president variable taking values gop and dem, and remove prez_dem and prez_gop; and remove the day variable.

```{r, message=FALSE}
#loading pols-month data
pols_month <- read_csv("data_hw2/fivethirtyeight_datasets/pols-month.csv")
```


```{r}
#cleaning the data
pols_month <- janitor::clean_names(pols_month) %>%
  #breaking up variable mon into integer variables: year, month, & day
  separate(mon, into = c("year", "month", "day"), convert = TRUE) %>%
  mutate(
    #replacing month num with month name
    month = case_match(
      month,
      1 ~ "january",
      2 ~ "february",
      3 ~ "march", 
      4 ~ "april",
      5 ~ "may",
      6 ~ "june",
      7 ~ "july",
      8 ~ "august",
      9 ~ "september",
      10 ~ "october",
      11 ~ "november",
      12 ~ "december"),
    #creating president variable
    president = case_when(
      prez_dem == 1 & prez_gop == 0 ~ "democratic",
      prez_dem == 0 & prez_gop == 1 ~ "republican")) %>%
  #removing prez_dem, prez_gop, and day variables
  select(-prez_dem, -prez_gop, -day)
```
